LET'S PLAY PRETEND
Oh hell no,"" Emma muttered under her breath when a firm hand hooked her elbow and pulled her out of the crowd.
It was the biggest event of the year, and inside were countless political and business players just begging to be featured in a story by Emma Swan, new reporter for the Storybrooke Daily Mirror.
Plastering her biggest, dumbest smile on her face, Emma gazed up at the black suited security guard and subtly cocked a hip to make the skirt of her best red dress ride up a little further. ""Yes?""
Name?""

Mary,"" Emma offered after a beat, batting her eyelashes a little. Inside she gussed loudly over not having an alias name ready for security, but her smile never slipped. It was such a rookie mistake, she was better than that and it was probably going to cost her a story. Goddammit.
Last name?"" was all the guard intoned flatly in response.
Oh come on now,"" Emma smirked, and leaned in to flash some boob and press her hand against the man's chest. ""I don't need a last name, you can't really tell me you don't recognise me?""
The guard looked down at her hand, and then calmly grasped her by the wrist and pushed her away.
The corner of her lip turned down into a tiny frown as he pressed his hand against his ear piece and repeated her fake name, as well as a brief physical description, and then listened intently.
Clearly her seduction skills had gotten a little rusty.

Sighing, Emma turned her head to watch at the crowd inching up the path and through the big double doors she'd been aiming for herself. She'd been so damn close. Carefully she noted down who was arriving as she waited, whether they were newsworthy, and who they were speaking to as they went.

It wasn't much more than any reporter lackey behind the red tape could see. But if all she managed to get out of this damn dress was a closer glimpse of the handshakes and initial wheeling and dealings of the city's powerful, it would just have to do.
The guard spoke into his head set sporadically for a long time, long enough for Emma to visually sweep the slow moving crowd multiple times and then get bored.

Emma gently tugged on her trapped hand, and then sighed when the guard didn't release his grip even a little bit. She looked around again, this time more casually, seeking anything interesting or out of place. A few new faces joined the back of the crowd, and she filed them away in her head.
Then she stopped, blinked, and frowned. A woman was gazing straight back at her from just inside the doorway, clad in sleek black with hair to match and an inscrutable expression on her face.
Right. You're not on the guest list, so you'll have to leave"" the guard said, interrupting Emma's staring match and beginning to march her back towards the kerb.
Wait,"" Emma cried. ""You don't-""
Excuse me."" The silky voice cut through the noise of the crowd effortlessly, stopping them both dead in their tracks.
The guard straightened his shoulders noticeably, and tightened his grip on Emma. ""Ms Mills,"" he said, voice as stiff as his back.
Sorry to interrupt, Graham.""

It was the woman who had been watching. Emma gaped a little as she took in the smooth bounce of her curls and red of her lips up close, and the slightly terrifying smile that was spreading across her lips.
I see you've bailed up my date, so I'm afraid I'll have to take her off your hands. If you don't mind...?""

She offered an arm to Emma as she spoke, as slick as anything despite both of Emma's arms still being trapped at her sides by the security guard. Not that they were for long, as the woman sharply raised an eyebrow in query and the guard sprang back a step.

I didn't realise,"" he said, manfully attempting to mask a discomfort that made Emma's inner reporter sit up and twitch. On the outside, however, she only subtly tugged her hemline back into place and edged towards her saviour. ""My apologies.""

Ms Mills inclined her head, and then turned her back on him completely. Her full attention was now pinned on Emma, who under the force of that gaze found herself busily resisting the urge to either defiantly raise her chin or melt back into the crowd.
Shall we, my dear?"" She leaned in to murmur in Emma's ear, arm still aloft for Emma to hold.

And Emma Swan, who all at once wanted both a big byline and to see how long it might take to mess up the lines of that black dress or that perfect lipstick, breathed deep and reached out to take her arm.
<center>*</center>
The room they walked into was cavenous and sparkling, and despite her best intentions to stay focused on the job, Emma caught herself feeling a little overwhelmed by all the glitz.

What do you think? Is it too much?"" the woman by her side asked, cutting through Emma's daze with a smug quirk of her lips that clearly stated she thought it was perfect exactly as it was. ""I asked for tasteful, discrete even, but there's just no stopping some people.""
No stopping you, Emma thought, but when she opened her mouth something entirely different came out. ""It looks amazing, Ms... Mills, was it?""

Call me Regina,"" she said, pulled Emma close to whisper conspiratorily in her ear while she nodded polite hellos to other attendees. Her hand slipped from Emma's arm to grip her firmly by the waist as she guided them through the crowd. ""You are supposed to be my date to the ball, after all.""
Her breath brushed the curve of Emma's ear with each word, making her shiver, which in turn made Regina's lips quirk up further.

If Emma was honest with herself, she hadn't really considered the logistics when she'd grasped hold of Regina like a drowning swimmer grasped a lifebuoy. But if she had, Emma wouldn't have expected to spend the rest of the evening by Regina's side. What would Regina want with a sparsley clothed, somewhat uncouth woman at a polished social event like this one?

Sure, Emma could be charming. She was counting on it to ferret out a story or two, after all. But she usually only sustained it for short periods of time, and she fully expected Regina to get bored and cut her adrift.
Just hopefully without calling security back to collect her.
But for some reason, she didn't. They spent the evening swinging between one group of important people and another (and another), introducing Emma as Regina's partner with each new greeting.

Many people that she'd only previously seen in photos and their names in print included her in small pleasantries and confidences. So much so that she quickly found total strangers nodding hello to her during the short stretches she was apart from Regina.

Each time they swung close to the restrooms as they traversed the huge room, Emma slipped away. She shut herself in a stall and hurridly scrawled down everything she could remember in the tiny notebook she had tucked into her garter, then flushed the toilet and checked her hair before diving back into the throng.
I just can't keep hold of you, can I?"" Regina had murmured after her third disappearance.

After that Regina had made sure to only steer them around the centre of the room. Emma had tried to excuse herself on the pretext of going to the bar to collect drinks for them both, but Regina had pinned her in place with an intent stare and imperiously beckoned over one of the wait staff instead.
I can't bear to spend a minute without her,"" she'd laughed to their current circle of gossipy socialites.
Her eyes were fixed on Emma's lips and her hand caressed the small of Emma's back as she spoke, and for a moment the room just faded away.

Emma'd had to shake her head to clear it, and then blush obligingly (and wasn't it a good thing Regina was still staring at her so intently, as if she wanted to eat Emma up like one of the many tiny, delicious canapes on offer) like she was shy and bashful instead of off her game and distracted.

It was everything she could have hoped for, and more than she'd dared to expect. Except for the way that Regina would then swing her off to greet someone else before she could properly grill the last person.
She had so many notes, but nothing of substance.
There was nothing ground breaking, only fluff for an event piece in the social pages. She almost suspected Regina of doing it deliberately, like she knew what Emma was up to....
But then someone else was asking how they met and remarking on how delightful they looked together, and it slipped her mind in favour of clinging closer to Regina's side and smiling.

A cover was a cover after all, especially one as good as Regina Mills, well known yet reclusive planner of all important events in Storybrooke. And if she smelt nice pressed along Emma's side, what of it? It was a hard job, but someone did have to do it.
<center>*</center>
The party seemed to break up while Emma wasn't looking, quickly leaving them in a half empty room that was beginning to look a little worse for wear.

It was a pleasure seeing you tonight,"" Regina was saying, shaking hands and farewelling yet more people, before turning back to Emma with a satisfied sigh. After a beat, she peered slyly over her shoulder and then grabbed Emma's hand. ""Think we can sneak away without being seen?""
Without waiting for a response, she started for an out of the way corner, tugging Emma along behind her.

Are you sure you don't need to say goodbye to anyone else?"" Emma asked with a laugh and a longing look back at prominent businessman Mr Gold who was still lingering at the bar. She hadn't even had a chance to say hello.
No, I think we've spoken to quite enough people for one night,"" Regina replied, and then veered sharply behind a large decorative plant, nearly tugging Emma clear off her feet.
Emma staggered with a yelp, only to find herself firmly caught in Regina's arms, with one of Regina's hands across her mouth the muffle her cry.
Not to worry, Ms Swan,"" she whispered, eyes sparkling. ""I've got you.""
Emma's heart was pounding in her chest
column2: she felt sure that Regina would be able to hear it, they were so close. As close as they'd been all evening, but somehow without the constant burble of chit chat and the clink of glasses over the top of everything, it felt much more intimate.

column1: I feel like I'm 13 and hiding at a school dance,"" Emma confessed quietly as she regained her footing.
I know, it's delightful.""

Emma ducked her head and peered through the leaves of their obliging plant cover. ""Are you sure you want to risk being seen back here with me, won't people talk?"" she joked, fingers clenching and unclenching at Regina's side.

And what would they talk about? I'm simply enjoying the end of a successful evening with my beautiful date, who I've been telling everyone has been the light of my life these last few months. It's hardly a recipe for scandal, now is it?""

I don't..."" Emma started, and then stopped herself. She could feel the edge of her notebook digging into her thigh at an awkward angle from the way she was pressed into the little niche Regina had found, but it somehow didn't seem so important in the moment.
Don't what, Ms Swan?"" Regina prompted gently.
Emma raised her eyes to meet Regina's gaze head on, determined not to falter this time. She was a journalist, not a mouse, after all.
I don't understand why you stopped them kicking me out.""
Regina smiled softly and raised a hand to tuck Emma's hair gently behind her ear.
I like beautiful things,"" she said, ""and you, Emma, are a beautiful thing.""

And Then Gladys Decided to Break In Her New Wheels by Driving Cross Country to Find Kate
Kate had been home a week when she saw it.

The house had that jaunty, bright look of fresh paint, with flowers by the path and brightly coloured curtains in all the windows. She watched from the corner as the mail man bundled a small sheath of papers into a picturesque letterbox, and suddenly a wave of longing overcame her.
Betty.

It was just like the home they'd spoken about, all the little details were there, the only thing missing was their names on the letterbox. The sun was rising high above it, and Kate just wanted to run to the door, and to the warmth of Betty's smile...

... but Betty didn't live there, and neither did Kate. As the sun rose higher, Kate let herself drift away past once more, and then away. But for the first time in one whole very very long week, Kate's heart was beating stronger than her fear.
*
She passed it again the next day, and the next, carrying scraps of food and hand me downs assembled by local church goers and passed along to a family mourning the recent loss of a father to the war.
One of the ladies who attended service had insisted on having Kate's help with the Johnson family. She had sung the praises of how a daughter might help her community over and over
column2: finally her father had grudgingly agreed to release her for the shortest possible length of travel time each day.

column1: And so each day, as regular as clockwork, Kate passed by the little cottage with its flowers by the path.

She delivered her basket, and squeezed hands, and loaned out a threadbare hankerchief. Then she turned around and walked back again, all the while trying desperately not to think of blonde hair and shy smiles and that swagger. Oh, that swagger. One day it would make her smile, and the next it would make her frown, but always - always - the gay little bobbing blossoms she passed each day would remind her of it.
Thus Kate's days formed into something of a rhythm, and, well trained by the routine of the factory floor, she unthinkingly fell into it.
Until one day, as she stood once more admiring the peonies, Gladys arrived.
*
Betty didn't think you'd agree to see her,"" Gladys said, eyes wide and hand hesitantly outstretched.
Why would I?"" Kate returned sharply, then clenched her jaw and turned her face away again.

Please-"" Gladys started, but Kate raised her eyes to the sky and bit her lip and stopped listening. Gladys' voice dulled into a hum, raising and falling in agitation, until finally it stopped and Kate lowered her eyes again.
You're not coming with me, are you,"" Gladys said, voice flat.
I... I don't want anything to do with that life anymore. It's wrong, and sinful, and-""
That life? That life? Kate, that was your life, every minute of it. It was yours and yours alone, you can't tell me you didn't love it and you can't just leave it behind!""
Kate pursed her lips, casting her eyes from Gladys to the flower bed to Gladys and back again.
'I..."" she started, then stopped and took a deep breath. ""My name is Marion.""
Gladys dipped her head forward to catch Kate's words, gaze intent and unwavering.
I don't want anything to do with my sinful past anymore!""
Gladys sighed and pulled away. ""I can see I'm not getting through to you...""
She paused, and then reached out to grab Kate's hand, refusing to relent when Kate started and tried to pull away.

Some money,"" she said, stuffing notes into Kate's fist. ""Money and the name of the hotel where I'm staying, I'll be there with a friend for the week. Please Kate, take it, I won't let you tell me no.""
Then she was gone in a swirl of skirts and perfume, leaving Kate with a basket of food in one hand, and a handful of paper and small notes in the other.
*

That night, Kate didn't sleep. She lay still and silent, her eyes closed and her hand grasping her pendant, the other casually laid across the corner of the mattress she'd stuffed the money and the note under.

The next night was the same, barely drifting off before startling awake to check her hiding place was still safe. She couldn't understand why it was so important to her - it was only enough change to get across town to the fancy hotel scrawled in the note. Just enough to stop Kate tracking Gladys down for the sole purpose of returning her money.

She barely breathed as she lay in the dark, but her mind had no such orderly quiet. It flitted from one thing to another, back and forth, never stopping. Except on thoughts of Betty. Always back to thoughts of Betty.
*

In the morning Kate left home as usual with her basket in hand and the money stashed in her clothes. She meekily agreed to hurry back, and then shuffled down the street until out of sight. Then she raised her head and strode, with strength and purpose and a little bit of borrowed swagger.

When she reached the Johnson family home, she dropped the basket on their doorstep and kept walking. She didn't even tarry to examine flower beds or look back over her shoulder at another certain cheery porch.
By the time she knocked on Gladys' door, she was gasping for breath with a laugh in her lungs and a piece of scrunched up note paper clenched in her hand so tightly it had torn.
Gladys,"" she cried out when she heard the latch click. ""Gladys, it's me, it's Kate. I want to go with you!""
Then the door swung open, and Kate stopped stock still.
Kate."" It was all Betty said, tears in her eyes and the edge of the door clenched in her hand till her knuckles turned white. ""Kate.""

Another voice came from deeper in the hotel suite. ""Kate? Did I hear you say Kate?"" Then the door was tugged from Betty's hand, causing her to waver for a moment without something to lean on, and swung wide to reveal Gladys' smiling face.
Oh thank god,"" she said, throwing her arms around Kate. ""You came!""
I did!"" Kate laughed giddily, words muffled by Gladys' hair. ""I did come, I'm here.""
Well then,"" Gladys said once she had finally pulled back. ""Do you have your bag?""
No. No bag, I don't have anything to my name,"" Kate replied, a smile still firmly on her face, her eyes drifting back to Betty. ""It's just me again.""

Well that's perfect then! There'll be more room in the car and we can go shopping when we get back. You'll see, Kate,"" Gladys enthused, linking their hands and bouncing happily on her toes. ""It's going to be just like before, but even better.""

Betty didn't make a move forward to join them, hanging back in the shadow of the room. But she echoed Kate's smile so hard it looked like her cheeks must hurt, and even when Kate's attention made her duck her head and rub a hand across the back of her neck she didn't drop her gaze for a moment.

PICK A STAR

It all started one pleasant morning in Reinette's private courtyard in the Versaille gardens. Finally having shooed, cajoled and threatened away the last servant, she settled herself in front of her tea tray ready to enjoy a little peace in the sunshine.

Unfortunately that peace was interrupted by a flare of light - painfully bright to Reinette's eyes, even at mid-morning. Then a strange woman fell out of Reinette's favourite flowering hedge and crashed onto the delicate table set before her.
The commotion sent Reinette jumping, hands attempting to press and swing her skirts clear of flying furniture and crockery as she went.
It was a rather ineffectual attempt, all told. Reinette quickly found herself falling to the ground also, landing half on top of the woman to the tinkling sound of more crushed crockery.
Sorry about that,"" the woman gasped, her red lips wide in a grin and leaves in her hair, and a warm hand steady on Reinette's waist. ""Are you quite all right?""
Lost for breath in the rigid grasp of her skirts and corsets, Reinette attempted to feign a somewhat convincing nod in reply and to gather herself, but the woman's eyes narrowed.
Here now, let me -""

-no, I can move myself."" Reinette attempted to protest as one hand became two, but she was already being manoeuvered about quite firmly and she heaved a small sigh as she was propped up such that the boning in her corset shifted into a more forgiving position.
I insist. It's the least I can do, after pulling you down like that.""
No - truer - words,"" Reinette said between pulling the deepest breaths possible back into her lungs.

From her new vantage point on the ground, Reinette carefully scrutinised the woman as she breathed. She seemed to be made of flesh and blood, for she was solid and warm where they were still pressed against each other in a tangle. No monster in a strange mask...
Reinette shook herself slightly.
Be less paranoid, she scolded herself, the Doctor's message was clear. Versaille is safe for yet four more years.
The woman didn't appear injured. Her clothes seemed ragged and singed in places, and perhaps a little odd... Reinette thought. Then the woman kneeled up
column2: Reinette's eyes widened, she couldn't help but let them linger a moment on the sight of a woman in men's trousers.

column1: Reinette did not lift her gaze until her gasping began to lessen, and the woman held out her hands in response. Together they somehow managed to stuggle Reinette back to her feet.
Thank you,"" Reinette said, tightening her grip on the woman's hands for a moment before releasing her. ""Well then, who are you to be stumbling so brazenly about the royal gardens?""

The woman's smile slipped, replaced by something efficiently curious that took Reinette aback, leaving herself now feeling the scruitnized one. But before she could take offense it was speedily replaced by a fresh smile.
River Song,"" came the answer, with a little tip of the woman's head and a quirk of her lips.
And what, perchance, is your errand here Lady Song?""
Ooh, Lady, that's a new one-""
Reinette arched an eyebrow.

- I'm looking for someone. Have you, perchance, seen a man about recently? Tall, young, a little bit odd. My guidebook told me he might have very unusual hair for the current fashions. A bit tall, sort of... spikey.""
Reinette's brow furrowed.
Will you walk with me?"" she asked after a short pause, and began a slow pace away from the disaster of knocked down furniture and spoiled food.
When she wasn't instantly followed she motioned for Lady Song to join her.

You must forgive my curiosity, but what is this guidebook?"" Reinette asked after they had begun walking side by side. ""And what sort of book describes a man's grooming without also telling you his name?
A very special book. He's a doctor, if that rings any bells.""
Reinette asked sharply, ""a doctor? Are you injured? I'll call for assistance-""

No need, I dont have a scratch on me, see,"" Lady Song suddenly did a little twirl and dropped into a deep courtsey, holding imaginary skirts wide. A laugh rolled out of her mouth and across the courtyard as she did so, but it could not still the fear that had gripped Reinette's heart.
...I'm afraid I don't recall him,"" she said, lips pursed and eyes narrowed, but Lady Song paid no heed.
Are you sure? I hear he's quite memorable, I suspect he might have a little bit of a swagger-""
The lady rose from her courtsey as she spoke, still laughing, but her voice died when she looked upon Reinette's face.

I'm sorry, my dear,"" she said, voice quiet now and stripped of all gaiety. She raised a hand towards Reinette's face, but did not close the final distance when Reinette stiffened. ""I seem to have arrived too early. I take it the clocks haven't stopped again yet?""
Who are you?"" Reinette demanded, then demanded again when her only answer was a heavy sigh. ""Who are you?""
I am a... a friend.""
A friend who knows the Doctor? How?""

A story for another day, my dear."" Lady Song pulled up her sleeve, revealing a strangely thick leather bracelet with all sort of grooves and patterns on it. Reinette felt curiosity tugging at her. It reminded her of her glimpse into the Doctor's cold world, but she was not the sort of woman to be so easily swayed from her purpose. She refused to be.
Explain yourself,"" she demanded, reaching for the lady's elbow, tightening her grip when she received no answer. ""You are from his world, are you not? Answer me!""
Lady Song sighed again. ""Reinette...""
How do you know my name? Did he send you?""
No,"" she replied at last. ""No, the Doctor didn't send me. I came on my own, I had something to tell you.""
So the Doctor did not send you... yet you ask for him anyway?""

Spoilers,"" Lady Song said with a lilt back in her voice, then lifted a finger to Reinette's lips to still further questions. ""That means, my dear, that I cannot tell you yet. You know already that there are things that cannot be explained or easily understood, that some things must wait.""

Reinette opened her mouth again, but Lady Song only pressed her finger hard against her lips once more until Reinette could taste the salt on her skin. She stayed still, leaning in towards Reinette, her eyes intense and seemingly searching for something.
Then answer me this,"" she said ar last, once Lady Song seemed satisfied and dropped her hand, taking her silence for capitulation, ""you move through time as he does?""
Lady Song smiled wryly.

Are you seeing my life pressed together in a single day, rather than a lifetime, as he does? Oh but you will not answer that either,"" Reinette felt tears build inexplicably in her eyes, and tried to turn her face aside, but Lady Song would not let her.

Not a single day, never just a single day,"" she said, grasping Reinette by the shoulders, suddenly deathly serious. Then she pulled Reinette close and held her tightly. Her hair was soft against Reinette's cheek, the sensation only broken by the scratch of a leaf now pressed into her skin. ""I came too soon,"" she murmured, her tone angry, seemingly at herself.
Reinette pulled away after a moment, with a cough to cover her tears. Then she clenched her jaw and stood tall. ""You must see many wonders.""
You'll see them for yourself one day,"" said Lady Song, stepping back with a smile once more.
Reinette frowned. ""I don't understand, do you mean with the Doctor? I'll see those wonders with him?""
Lady Song reached for Reinette's hand and raised it to her own lips.

You told me once that to wait forever is to have no purpose, that only short stretches were truly tolerable. That if you were to be stuck on the slow path, then I must make it not seem so, for life is too glorious for all things to seem so slow. That is all I can say.""
I don't understand...""
You will. After the clocks have stopped and you have seen the Doctor for the last time, you will pick a star and I will come back for you."" And with that, she turned and began to walk away.
Reinette watched her hips sway for a moment before calling after her.
Lady Song? ... River!""
Those eyes were just as sharp and those lips just as red, Reinette found, when seen glancing back over a shoulder instead of in close quarters.
You said you had something to tell me?""

How silly of me! I would have had to come back a second time..."" River smirked. ""Your childhood fireplace, the one the Doctor spoke to you in, you need to have it moved to your new rooms before he returns. Don't forget now.""
Then she raised a hand in farewell, before lowering it to her wrist and blinking out of existance.

event,"Dear Yuletider, I'm still adding things to this letter! I'm going to aim to have some more info on my up this weekend, Yuletide matching just kind of crept up on me eep.
Optional details are optional, please only take away from this letter what is helpful to you, and most importantly have a great Yuletide! The only exception is the following:
These things may run the risk of being really distressing for me, and prevent me from enjoying your story: character death, mental illness, depression, self-harm or suicide, or similar themes.
Other than the above, feel free to utilise (or not) the following info however you like!
General likes and dislikes

I really like happy endings, romance, kissing, good communication and feelings, relationships built on mutual respect and caring, and stories that delve a little further into characters mental states and motivations. I'm much more character focused than plot focused, and love fic that can peel pack some of those layers for me.

If you decide to write femslash (or even female centric gen to some extent...) I like girl-on-girl chivalry, butch/femme dynamics (where applicable, femme/femme and butch/butch and not-easily-categorised can be really awesome as well!), and girls with swagger.

I also like poly, so affairs tend to confuse and distress me as needlessly hurtful to the other character(s). Feel free to make canon relationships open ones, officially break them up, just ignore them and leave them off screen, whatever. This isn't to say that I never come across good fics or believable scenarios around infidelity, but by and large it isn't my thing.

If you like to write higher ratings, fic kinks and acts I find interesting include D/s, bondage, fingerbanging, cunnilingus, strap-ons, kissing, breasts and things related to them, corsets, lipstick, sex against walls, and light painplay like spanking or clamps as long as skin is never broken. Mostly I like all of these as means of the characters having joyful, fun sex, or demonstrations of the trust within their relationship.

Some of this is pretty lesbian centric, please don't worry if you're writing Inheritance Trilogy! I do want to see fic for it just as much! It's just one of my only not-femslash-possible requests this fic season. I think the dynamic of all three of them in bed together could make for some interesting sex in and of itself, and I'd also be very interested to see some BDSM elements. Just be careful of power play if some of the emotional baggage around Shahar hasn't been fixed yet in your storyline, please.

I don't like power play if there's also a power issue within the relationship outside sex, but otherwise I'm not going to try and police my squicks here. It's way too hard to cover everything and they can change from fandom to fandom, so I just refer you back to my like!
I Can't Think Straight (Leyla, Tala)

<i>I'd love gen or femslash equally, so please feel comfortable to go in either direction! I like introspection, feelings, and happy endings. I don't like mental illness, character death, unproductive angst, or self-destructive acts. If you go gen, please don't rewrite Leyla/Tala as a friendship - if you go femslash, I like romantic gestures, girl-on-girl chivalry, power play in the bedroom.

Some possible story ideas: Leyla and Tala building their lives together post-movie, Leyla's life as a writer, missing scenes of Leyla's short relationship with Jennifer (the on-screen girlfriend - I would be happy for you to write about all three of my characters, or just Leyla, or just Leyla/Tala or just Leyla/Jennifer!)
Inheritance Trilogy - N. K. Jemisin (Dekarta, Shahar, Sieh)

<i>I found the idea of Sieh/Deka/Shahar growing into their own three-god triad really intriguing. I like the idea of fated ships where everyone still needs to put hard work into the relationship, communication, and domesticity. I don't like mental illness, or character death (you don't have to re-write around canon deaths, but please don't focus on them.)

Some possible story ideas: Will they learn from the mistakes of the original three? How might they have come together as a three if Sieh hadn't started aging? What sort of life did Shahar live without them? What will it take for Shahar to feel integrated and secure after being apart from them?
Haven (Audrey Parker, Claire Callahan)

<i>I find Claire and Audrey to be very interesting for the same reason - they can both be a little bit inscrutable. I've love to see that explored further as gen or femslash. I like women standing by and up for each other, and women who are strong and don't apologise for having their own agendas. For femslash, I like romantic gestures and butch/femme dynamics. I don't like mental illness, character death, or the canon het love triangle.

Some possible story ideas: what if Claire is not inscrutable not because she's new to the show, but because she knows she'll be leaving Haven with Audrey? What sort of long-term friend/relationship might they have if Audrey finds a way to stay in Haven? Claire and Audrey successfully handling a big trouble case on their own.
Tipping the Velvet - Sarah Waters (Nan, Flo)

<i>Nan and Flo are my lesbian happily ever after story. I was particularly enamoured of them in the TV series, and then I read the books and still was quite obsessed. I love how real they are, how much they both throw themselves into their relationship (unlike Nan/Kitty for instance), and how they build their life together piece by piece. I even love the rag-tag brother(in-law) and adopted son domestic set up they have going on. I don't like mental illness, character death, or the idea of Nan not actually being committed to Flo (over another of her previous lovers) after all.

Some possible ideas: Nan and Flo meet someone intriguing and sexy at their local lesbian bar (I like poly and threesomes, if you'd like to go there, or they just get some ideas to take home with them), more scenes of their life together, how meeting Nan's family went.

Listed fandom requests:
1. The Devil Wears Prada (movie), Emily/Andy

Emily was my favorite character, followed closely by Andy, and I still wish that the movie had shown more of the relationship between them. I feel like Emily had a lot more promise to live up to, and would love to see some of that played out. When it comes to the Andy side of this pairing, I found her canon arc very satisfying, and I'd love to see her further along in that. So I guess in many ways this pairing is largely about seeing a bit of a spark there, and wishing for a happy ending for them both, preferably together.
2. Doctor Who: ""New Who"", Lady Christina/River, Lady Christina/Esther Drummond

Christina made me squee and clap my hands the first time I saw her on Who, and continues to whenever I rewatch her special. This is my most flexible request, if you think there's another character in New Who who she would work well with, please feel free to experiment and add additional pairings to either of the above! I like to think that meeting the Doctor sent Christina off on amazing and wild adventures, so feel free to send her spinning through time and space under own steam on the most flimsiest of pretences. I find her to be a really fun, really vibrant and unapologetic character, and just like to see her have fun, vibrant and unapologetic lesbian funtimes.
Wildcard fandom requests:
1. Lip Service, Lexy/Tess

I love Lexy's generally swaggery no nonsense approach, and I love Tess's sweet bumbling uselessness, and I think they would make the most adorable complimentary couple. Lexy's arc at the end of the season is the epitome of many things I Hate in pairings, and I'd love to see something to counter that. Perhaps where she's on her way to being less destructive and more genuinely into Tess - don't feel obliged to stick to the happy ending of this, I'd also be very happy to read her getting underway with this sort of an arc. I'd also love to see something AU to fix it completely, or something placed well post-her sorting that silliness out.
2. The Moth Diaries, Rebecca/Ernessa

If you're looking for a quick backup fandom to consider, The Moth Diaries is a movie! You might need to be a bit careful with this one, as mental illness and self-harm, etc., is built into the canon. Some ways of avoiding that subject matter might be: a rewrite of the storyline, where Ernessa disregarded Lucie and focused all that intensity directly and obviously on Rebecca, building on seduction rather than their similar family history to try and win her over
column2: a story where the vampirism mechanism ends up being different than Ernessa thought
column3: a post-movie AU where Rebecca is already a vampire and thus the way she becomes one can be skipped
column4: or a post-movie AU where they remain in the human/vampire configuration. Things I like about this fandom: vampires and all their sexy, kinky potential (please no blood play though), the intense emotions that tend to go with boarding school ships, and that Rebecca is a character I find to be very interesting in an adventurous, bullheaded yet somewhat introspective way. The small glimpses we get of Ernessa's personality beyond the vampirism (eg. the sweet smiling end of her exchange with Rebecca when looking at the photograph) really intrigued me as well.

column1: 3. Out at the Wedding, Risa/Jeannie

If you're looking for a quick backup fandom to consider, Out at the Wedding is also a movie! There are a lot of things in this movie that make me cringe a little, particularly the main character and her best friend. But if you can get past them and focus on the reasonably sizeable screen time of Risa and Jeannie, I think you'll find a really enjoyable story. I loved them as separate characters, I loved their dance together, I loved how quickly and seamlessly they fell together as an adorable perfect couple. Flesh out their canon story with the sort of scenes that wouldn't have been offscreen if they were the main characters, write something post-movie, write an AU where they're a magic wielding princess and a knight and have the same adorable dynamic. Just have them together and adorable and happy however you want to swing it.

event,"Firstly, I'm a festivids newbie, so believe me when I say I'll be easy to please. I decided to bite the bullet on my exchange vidding nerves early in my vidding years, because I remember how swept up by everything I was with my first Yuletide and how much I wished I hadn't let nerves keep me back. So, I'll be really easy to wow! Promise! I'm super in love with your vid already, just because it'll be all for me and part of an awesome exchange, whee.

If you've checked my journal for a letter more than once since assignments went out, you may have noticed I've been absent from fandom a lot lately. It's been health related, and I'm really super sorry for the delay! I hope my lack of festividder letter hasn't caused you any massive dramas! I've included my letter here along the lines of what I would have posted if I'd been on time, but if you've already started and anything here clashes with the work you've already done, please, you absolutely have my permission to ignore anything here even more than I would usually encourage!
<lj-cut>

As I said in all my music notes, I'd much prefer you to vid with whatever music moves you. I do have mix tags: my fanmixes and my genmixes, but being new to vidding I don't feel at all qualified to be able to make song suggestions foe other people without inadvertently making things super difficult. Not to mention, there are plenty of vids I've loved made to music that I didn't like or wouldn't have expected to find likeable until I got to listen to it in the context of a wonderful vid. With any creative work I always prefer things that have clicked with the creator and their style over anything forced for the sake of fulfilling details that don't fit quite right, so please feel free to go wherever your preferred music takes you.

As far as tone and style and all that, like I said, I'm all new to vidding and everything. So I'm easily dazzled, and I'm constantly being surprised by the vids I enjoy! My preferences generally run towards female characters and femslash, as you've probably noticed from my request details, but I'm not adverse to boyslash or het as well. The way I fangirl is primarily via the medium of squee, so I particularly like character and relationship vids that are all about celebrating the awesomeness. I've also grown very fond of vids that cut to a strong beat and make me want to dance and laugh.

At the same time, I've seen a few amazing vids that construct a story that's different to the canon, and some wonderful critique and meta vids, and vids that are slow and atmospheric, and so much more. I still have so much to learn about what goes into a vid that wows me, so please feel free to expand my horizons! The most important ingredient in a great vid (or any sort of fanwork) is that you believe in it, so please disregard anything in this post that makes things difficult for you.
Covert Affairs

If you're not familiar with Covert Affairs but like to know the source footage details for potential back-up-ness, there has only been one season of 11 episodes aired to date, and as far as I'm aware no DVDs have been released yet.
Details: Pairings that make me happy: Annie/Auggie, Annie/Jai, and Annie/Joan. Plus anything gennishly Annie or Joan centric!
The Good Wife

If you're not familiar with The Good Wife but like to know the source footage details for potential back-up-ness, there has been one season of 23 episodes released on DVD and season two is still in the process of airing. If you'd prefer to stick to the first season because of the annoyance of continual new canon while being creative, that also wouldn't cause me any disappointment whatsoever!

Details: I love Kalinda oh so much, so she'd be my first choice for a vid. If Kalinda/Alicia or a general Kalinda/women femslashy vid hits your buttons, that would also be totally awesome, but anything women centric would be equally fantastic.
Hellcats

If you're not familiar with Hellcats but like to know the source footage details for potential back-up-ness, at the time of writing and posting this letter there are ten episodes of Hellcats aired, each around the 40 minute mark. It's still airing, so that will obviously increase, but you could also very easily vid with just the episodes already available right now and make me a very happy camper.

Details: I adore Savannah, find her completely adorable, and kind of wish for a show all about her. However, I would also love to see a Marti/Savannah vid, or an ensemble vid about the cheerleading team as a group, rather than the Marti+team perspective the show often gives us.
Kissing Jessica Stein (safety)
If you're not familiar with Kissing Jessica Stein but like to know the source footage details for potential back-up-ness, it is a movie and obviously, as a safety, under the 180 minute mark.

Details: The ending of KJS still continues to disappoint me, even years later. A happily ever after!Jessica/Helen vid, a vid where Jessica goes on to have healthy and fully sexual relationships with women, or really anything in the realm of fluffy shippy love, would delight me enormously.
Lost in Austen

If you're not familiar with Lost in Austen but like to know the source footage details for potential back-up-ness, it's a four part mini-series, and without checking the actual episodes myself, Wikipedia informs me each one runs to around 45 minutes.
Details: I found LiA's Caroline Bingley quite intriguing, and I'd love to see a vid about her and/or about her femslashy relationships (with Amanda, or without if you prefer.)
Young Americans
If you're not familiar with Young Americans but like to know the source footage details for potential back-up-ness, there are eight episodes in all, each I believe in the 40 minute bracket.

Details: Pairings that make me happy are Jake/Hamilton, Jake/Bella, and Bella/Paige. Gen things I'd also love to see would be something that plays up Jake as possibly genderqueer rather than just playing pranks on family members (whatever the angsty reason), or more focused on the female characters than the canon - especially Paige and/or Caroline.

THE MANY WAYS

Claire sneaks into the dorms under the cover of darkness, scaling a ridiculously high fence in an isolated corner of campus - snapping her ankle back into place absentmindedly after she lands - to avoid being seen, and peering around every corner at length before rounding it. Once she reaches her own room, she backs through the door silently, keeping each step measured and soft and only letting the door slide back into its frame by the tiniest of inaudible increments.
Then she very nearly ruins all her hard work by yelling when arms wrap themselves around her shoulders.
Hey, you,"" Gretchen murmurs sleepily into her hair, and tightens her hold. ""It's only me.""

Claire breathes in and out deeply, just once, to try and calm her racing heart, and then turns in the circle of Gretchen's arms and tips her head forward to nestle in the crease of her neck. Gretchen's arms slip clumsily down to her waist, and Claire lets herself go limp, just resting against her.

I saw you on the news,"" Gretchen continues talking, half to herself, her voice thick and clumsy. Claire smiles against Gretchen's skin as the sound of her voice slowly fills the room, half-heartedly pursing her lips into something of a kiss as they stand there, leaning against each other. ""I was so proud of you, Claire. So very proud.""
They're cocooned in Gretchen's sheets not long after, Claire still dressed except for her jacket dropped by the door and her shoes toed off as they stumbled towards the nearest bed.
It's only been a few hours and I already hate dodging reporters,"" Claire confesses, whispering, her head pillowed on her arm.
Do you regret it?"" Gretchen asks, her eyes wider now, more awake.
No,"" Claire says after a long pause. ""No, I don't think I could.""
*
I can't believe you did that!""

Claire opens her mouth to ask what the hell she's doing here, just inside the doorway of Claire's father's apartment, but then thinks better of it. The television is blaring in the background, playing the footage of Claire's jump over and over, and there's blue electricity crackling around Elle's hands.
I thought you were dead,"" she settles for asking instead.
I thought we were a secret,"" Elle snarls in response.
Yeah, well,"" Claire shrugs and tosses her bag into a corner, out of the way, and shuts the door behind her. ""Nothing ever seemed to change while everyone was hiding.""
Who says it needed to?"" Elle asks, her voice rising into a shriek.
Claire just cocks her head to the side and looks her up and down. ""The fact that you didn't bother to tell anyone you survived Sylar's attack, did.""

Elle's jaw works for a moment, but apparently she can't find anything to say to that because it snaps shut again without a word. She sniffs daintily and raises her chin, and the blue around her hands settles down into small sparks. Claire waits a beat, then shrugs and brushes past her.
Are you hungry?"" She asks over her shoulder when she reaches the refrigerator.
*

Still no regrets?"" Gretchen asks again a week later, a smile on her lips and caution in her voice. They're huddled together in the backseat of a car staffed by Petrelli bodyguards, following the 'suggestion' that Claire temporarily vacate campus
column2: ""to avoid disturbing other students during this period of media attention, you understand.""

column1: No,"" Claire replies through gritted teeth.
Good, me neither.""
Claire glances at Gretchen out of the corner of her eye, lips twitching when she sees the cheery, determined expression fixed on her face.
Are you sure?""
The smile widens, becoming more easy, and more genuine. Even the girlfriend of the Amazing Healing Girl! didn't attract as much attention as Claire herself
column2: Gretchen had been more than welcome to remain at college.

column1: Of course,"" she says. Claire bumps their shoulders together and Gretchen responds by leaning over and kissing her enthusiastically.
She catches the drivers eyes glancing away in the rearview mirror as they break apart, and reaches over to the control for the privacy partition with a smirk.
You know I'd always rather be with you,"" Gretchen whispers in her ear as they wait for the partition to hum its way up to the ceiling.
*

Claire's phone rings while they're eating. Gretchen flashes across the screen, but Claire hits the ignore button after only a second's hesitation. She notices Elle is watching her, blatant curiosity on her face, but she pretends not to see. Peter and her father had ushered her away from the circus after only a brief talk with the reporters, and then everything had gone kind of crazy. By the time she'd been able to get through to Gretchen, she'd already gotten a message from college, asking her to please keep the media frenzy away from the other students.

Gretchen had sounded so happy for her on the phone. She'd kept repeating how proud she was, and Claire believed her. She really did. But Gretchen didn't deserve to get caught up in this particular whirlwind, and somehow, Claire talked to her less and less.
Are you going to eat that?"" Elle asks, breaking into her thoughts. Her fork was pointed at the untouched bread roll beside Claire's plate.
Go nuts,"" she says, wearily, and nudges it in Elle's direction.

Elle's fork clatters to the table and she quickly grabs the roll. ""What?"" she asks indignantly, when she notices Claire still watching her. ""It's a little hard to make ends meet when you're pretending to be dead.""
Claire tries hard to hide her surprise, and motions casually towards the kitchen, saying ""feel free to help yourself to whatever"" and pretending not to see the gratitude on Elle's face.
*

Your grandmother is really nice, but she still kind of freaks me out,"" Gretchen says for the fourth day running after they hole up in one of Angela's city apartments, the sixth Petrelli property in their tour of expensive and heavily fortified lodgings.
Claire just laughs and pulls her back into bed. ""I'm fairly sure that's the impression she intends to give.""
Is this some sort of 'you corrupted my granddaughter' thing?"" Gretchen asks, pulling faces and pitching her voice low, making Claire laugh harder.
I doubt it, I've never been especially easy to control. I think she's resigned herself to that by now.""

I suppose going on Larry King against her advice rates higher on the corruption scale than taking a lesbian lover these days."" Gretchen sighs heavily, adopting an expression of abject woe until Claire hits her in the face with a pillow. ""How can I compete with Larry King?"" she asks, her voice plaintive and muffled.
*
Heard something interesting today,"" Claire says loudly from the lounge room in her best innocent voice when she hears Elle come in.

Oh yeah?"" Elle calls from the front hall. There's a few crashing sounds and Claire rolls her eyes before Elle sticks her head into room, hanging off the doorframe with one hand and grinning like a lunatic.
Yeah,"" Claire says, calmly continuing to fold laundry from where she's sitting cross-legged by the coffee table. ""Apparently you might have super powers, too.""

Elle abruptly pulls herself upright again, grin only slightly lessened, and watches Claire cautiously. When all she does is tilt her head towards the couch cushions, where a gossip rag is thrown open to a full page picture of the two of them, Elle just shrugs. Like she couldn't help herself.

What? I got sick of the old headlines. Does Claire Bennet have a live-in girlfriend? Please."" Elle flips her hair back over her shoulder with a pout. ""As if that's the only interesting thing about me!""

A little warning would have been nice, that's all."" Claire keeps folding, struggling to keep the grin off her face. ""My dad brought that around in a rage, and I've already had three calls from Angela to complain about shoddy public relations work.""
Elle drops onto her stomach next to the magazine, limbs sprawled and hair hiding her face.
You're not the only one who can be impulsive,"" she mutters, the edge of a whine in her voice.

Claire pushes to her feet and steps around the coffee table, nudging at Elle's hips with her knee until she rolls onto her side, making room for Claire to sit. Claire props herself up, leaning over her, and brushes Elle's hair out of her eyes.

You're beautiful,"" she says, and kisses Elle, hard. She can feel Elle smiling again, into the kiss, and then suddenly she flips them off the couch and Claire's head hits the corner of the coffee table. Then they're just laughing - Elle straddling her stomach, and Claire healing - and making out like teenagers.
*

It's a good thing we made that agreement with the Dean that we'd live off campus this semester,"" Gretchen says conversationally with her fingers twisting inside Claire, her other hand tangled with Claire's, pressing it into the mattress beside her head. Claire groans inarticulately, pulling helplessly at Gretchen's leg hitched up across her own and arching her hips.
The sun streaming through the curtains is warm against Claire's breast, and Gretchen is also warm, stretched along her body with her lips at Claire's throat.
Because you've been getting rather loud lately.""
She can feel the muscles in Gretchen's back shifting and then the angle of her fingers change, and her thumb brushes against her clit, and Claire arches again, practically screaming on command.
*

Claire wakes quickly and stays perfectly still, listening, her vision blocked by the usual disarray of pillows about her head. She carefully tugs down with her hands and hears the clink of metal on metal.
Good morning,"" Elle practically purrs from behind her, and hands slide up her spine. Claire shivers.

Handcuffs? Really?"" Claire shifts awkwardly, trying to find enough leverage with her elbows against the pillows to take the weight off her wrists. She tries to rise to her knees as well, and to twist so she can look Elle in the eye, but the hands against her back press down when she moves, keeping her flat against the mattress.
Happy coming-out-as-a-freak anniversary,"" Elle says with a giggle. ""I thought today deserved something special.""

Is that what I can feel, something special?"" Claire asks wryly, and Elle laughs again and thrusts her hips, nudging something long and solid against the back of Claire's thigh. ""I don't remember that particular shopping trip making the headlines.""

That's my secret to keep,"" Elle singsongs and settles in more firmly against Claire's back. Claire groans and drops her head back down in acceptance at the feel of Elle's breasts against her skin, and her hands slowly making their way to her legs, holding her down and wide.
I want to see it,"" she mumbles, turning her head to the side to breathe deeply and gasp out the words.

Mm,"" Elle hums. ""Maybe later, if you're good."" She eases Claire's legs apart and runs a finger along her vulva, making her buck against the mattress. ""But only if you're very good,"" she promises.

In cheerier news, I finally got around to checking out Rizzoli & Isles, and oh my freaking god, it was everything you guys said it would be! New femslashy fandom time, hip hip hooray! \o/ Guysguysguys, if you're not, you really need to be watching this.
Reasons you need Rizzoli & Isles more than you need to sleep, or eat, or, y'know, be alive:
1. The femslash subtext is through the freaking roof!
2. Even if you're not a femslasher, it has two fantastic lead characters - Jane Rizzoli and Maura Isles - who are brilliant together on screen.
--> 2b. And if you missed the names, they're both women!
-----> 2c. And it passes the Bechdel test both technically, and in spirit.

3. Jane's partner Barry Frost is adorable and awesome, and has loads of character potential. Aand is played by the wonderful Lee Thompson Young! Who you may know as Victor/Cyborg from Smallville, Al Gough from Flashforward, or Derek on Scrubs.
4. Barry and Jane's ex-partner, Vince Korsak, have this hi-ilarious odd couple rivalry thing going over who gets to be Jane's Partner.
5. Jane looks awesome in a dress, on the odd occasion that she wears them.
--> 5b. Maura likes to dress her.
6. Mama Rizzoli is ridiculous and makes you want to pinch her cheeks.
--> 6b. Mama Rizzoli, Jane and Maura have this amazing, side-hurting level of in-law shenanigans vibe going between the three of them.
7. Jane and Maura are hot. And subtexty. And make other people speak for them when they're fighting. And they don't take shit from nobody. Basically: serious awesome points.

8. If you need more convincing (seriously, is there something wrong with you?) here's a great little behind the scenes/promo thing to give you a visual introduction to the characters: Rizzoli & Isles: An Overview.
<lj-cut text=""Quick 1.01 warning note, spoilers for the pilot only."">Quick 1.01 warning note, spoilers for the pilot only.

Obviously, this is a crime show, but I've so far found it to be on the lower end of confronting for a crime show (although I do lack violence related triggers, feel free to comment or email me - eleara@gmail.com - if you need to know anything specific), apart from the pilot. The show is fantastic in the way that the pilot just jumps straight into the deep end, with the central crime being related to a previous incident where Jane was attacked by a perp when she tried to rescue a victim.

I was surprised by how unnerved I ended up being through the pilot, with Jane becoming a victim, again, and being under constant threat of being targeted by the same serial killer, again. Which is a big credit to the creative team behind the show because it's not something that normally bothers me on a reflexive gut level in fictional portrayals! I might yell at the screen, but it's not one of things that makes me want to cover my face/ears or leave the room for a break, at least not usually. The R&I pilot, though? Totally had me at that level of ack in a number of points. You might need to tread carefully with the pilot if you have any problems with women being stalked/targeted/attacked in a violent and/or particularly sadistic manner.

column1: Some general info on me:

I'm super-excited about my assignment, so I really hope you're happy with yours as well and I haven't flummoxed you with any of my pairings! If I have, let me reassure you that I tend to ship because I adore both/all of the characters, so if you work from that premise you should be golden.

As far as the bare minimum you need, there are things in fic that can harm my state of health (triggers: depression*/self-harm/suicide, and character death) that I'll obviously need you to avoid, but now I've got that out of the way you're welcome to stop here. I'd much prefer you write a story you can believe in than struggle to include anything I've written below, so please feel free to only take from this authors letter what will be helpful and discard the rest!

*I do, however, love it when characters in fandom represent a wider range of difference than we get in canon, so while I'd prefer you not write a story about one of my favourite ladies that dwells on the negative experiences of having a mental illness because I can't guarantee I'd be able to read it, I do love it when characters have a mental illness/monopolar depression/bipolar and it doesn't sum up everything interesting about them. So don't feel like you have to avoid the subject completely if you like to write that wider range, just stick to the positive side/portrayals.

But if you would like more information about things I do and don't like, do read on... I really like happy endings because fic is usually my happy place. I don't mind angst but I really don't like unredeemingly dark fics (light at the end of the tunnel ftw). I love it when relationships tell us something more about the characters, I'm cool with mild bondage/kink if you write porny things, and I'm also cool with utterly non-porny things as well! I'm a big fan of fluff, I like it when characters don't believe in the whole ridiculous 'one true love' thing but they kind of feel that way about someone anyway, and I love it when characters are subtly physically affectionate with their loved ones.

In regard to existing non-femslash relationships members of my pairings might be in: I like happy polyamorous situations, dislike sexuality labels, and really hate it when characters cheat for no real reason and handwave it like trust isn't a huge important thing in a relationship and listening to your downstairs brain is a good reason to sex up someone else without your partners permission. Sometimes people are flawed and mess up, and that's fine, but I like communication and acknowledgement if they do. I'm also totally cool with situations that allow for open canon relationships offscreen, crazy AUs, clearly very serious ideas like giving people amnesia to facilitate make outs without breaking up other relationships, or however else you might like to get around the things I don't like characters to do though!

Basically, just respect the characters and their existing relationships in some fashion if you're writing within the current canon, and I'll love you forever. For instance, feel free to divorce Rory and Amy in Doctor Who so Amy can have lesbian make outs, I just need to believe that it was this huge difficult thing that acknowledges how important Rory is to Amy in canon first. But feel free to break up or not mention Larita/Mr Whittaker or Sarah/John in Easy Virtue just 'cause it's easier, because there wasn't really a chance for them to become serious, important romantic relationships.

1. Doctor Who: Amy Pond/Lady Christina de Souza

What I really love about these women is that neither of them is shy. They both kissed the Doctor! Neither of them feel the need to wait for his permission or guidance! They're both very capable of confounding a 900 year old alien genius! My biggest lament about Lady Christina is that she met Ten, not Eleven, because she left us too soon and I think Eleven would totally have hustled her into his TARDIS like the clever thing he is. I pretty much love very similar things about Amy and Christina, and I'd love to see them adventuring together and leaving the Doctor all bewildered in dust (it's totally my favourite thing when the human characters gather and giggle about the Doctor while he waitwhat?'s in their general direction.)

But I have to admit that I'm not a big fan of cheating!Amy or insecure!Rory. So if you'd like to perhaps AU it, divorce them, or write Rory being okay with an open relationship at some point in the future because they travel with the Doctor together for ages and he gets all secure while they do so, or maybe strand Amy somewhere with amnesia and have Christina ride to her rescue, that'd be totally awesome. But since the finale I also totally OT3 Amy, Rory and the Doctor, so if you want to Amy to psh-posh Christina's 'er, aren't you married?' by her saying Rory's happily entertained with the Doctor at that particular moment, you would make my little multi-shipper heart very happy.

I'm afraid I have very little in the way of ideas and die-hard preferences to offer beyond that though, because I really don't mind what or how you write them, as long as they're both kicking arse and taking names and making out! So really, feel free to give them a moving monogamous relationship or just get Amy and Christina to have a heart thumping, adventure thrilled fling, or anything in between!
</lj-cut>
2. Merlin: Morgana/Nimueh

I'd love to see something set in a future where Nimueh didn't really die (because Merlin mastered the power of life and death instinctually? Really? Really really?) or an AU. Perhaps a history repeating theme with a Morgause who was originally opposed to Nimueh's more extreme methods, and - through Morgause - Morgana has now met Nimueh and is confronted with the same problem of ideological conflict with more experienced (hot!) mentor(s) already pushed to their limits by Uther.

There also aren't enough modern Merlin AUs with girlslash instead of the boys, or it'd be really lovely and sweet to see something set in a world where Uther didn't go totally bonkers and Nimueh was free to train and guide Morgana in her magic and they could just be magical and awesome and happy and there was less burning people at the stake and general angst.

I didn't put Morgause/Morgana in my pairings list because, well, I do sometimes struggle with the hot vs. incestuous thing, plus it's an easier/more popular pairing and I'd really love to see me some more Morgana/Nimueh, hee. But I do also ship them like crazy and am totally happy with including Morgause in the femslash fun in some fashion if you like to write threesomes, triangles, backstory or multi-pairing fics, as long as there's still plenty of the Morgana/Nimueh for me to enjoy. So feel free to add her to the mix if you so prefer or it facilitates your particular plot bunny! I'm also totally okay with you including Morgause to more easily hook Morgana and Nimueh up (Nimueh as Morgause's magical mentor is very much my personal canon), but respecting the whole sisters arrangement and not incestuously slashing them, because I think Morgana and Morgause are adorable however you decide to read the way they smile and dance around each other.
</lj-cut>
3. The Vampire Diaries: Elena/Caroline/Bonnie, Jenna/Isobel

First up, I'm only familiar with the show at present, so I'm super sorry if you tend towards the books and got assigned to me for TVD because I have zip knowledge on them beyond the assumption that there's some degree of similarity with the television series. I don't mind at all if you want to write something that could fit in either canon though, assuming of course I can understand it without having read the books yet. A general squick I also have for this fandom is dismissing Caroline as silly, shallow, someone who doesn't need to be given as much consideration, etc. just because she acts her age - give her depth and emotional weight and importance without rewriting that she frequently acts like a typical teenager who hasn't figured herself or the world out yet, and I will totally fall at your feet and worship.
Elena/Caroline/Bonnie

I would be perfectly happy to take these three together any way I can get it! But I should warn you I have a bit of a squick for characters agreeing on polyamory and it ending up being more of a jealous triangle fic. Jealous triangles I can totally get behind though, as long as they're self-aware and admitted jealous triangles! Beyond that, go nuts. Feel free to write any pair out of these three as the romantic relationship and slip the third girl in in a flirty, past, or unrequited fashion. Or put a new spin on the romantic triangle and have them each crush on another without anyone reciprocating a crush, for an endless circle jerk of angst! Genuine bicurioisty, subtexty longing, functioning and happy polyamory, or really whatever floats your boat is also totally fine by me.

As far as canon relationships go, these three characters are an exception for me, in that I don't mind how you handle existing relationships. Feel free to just pretend they don't exist without working in a reason or engineering a situation that doesn't mean Elena or Caroline are cheating on Matt/Stefan/Damon! I am so totally behind you still doing so if you'd like to, it's just not going to ping any cheating issues for me if you don't address it.

If you'd like some more specific prompts to kick off with: Caroline's little joke that Elena's anti-vampire-compulsion gift was a lesbian love token makes me giggle forever and ever, I think Elena might appear all femme but she'd go all butch when it comes to courting girls, I find Bonnie going all macho bodyguard over Elena to be smoking hot, it's my own personal canon that Caroline gets snarky sometimes because she and Elena had the beginnings of a fling that got abruptly curtailed by Elena's horrid summer of horridness and she's totally bitter, and Caroline's insecurity totally needs to be fixed with ladysexing.
Jenna/Isobel

If I was feeling all confessiony right now, I'd probably just tell you that I find Jenna hot, and I find Isobel hot, and I want them to be hot together. If I felt like engaging my upstairs brain I'd also have to say all the messed up intricacies of Elena's new pseudo-mum and her bio-mum getting it on is more intriguing than I would ever have thought, and writer to writer I have to say that the question of how a curious Isobel might finagle Jenna into bed when she can't use compulsion makes me really excited, only, I'm totally stumped on the how. To be perfectly honest, as much as I love that the show gives us all these wonderful scenes between female characters, I kind of wish Jenna hadn't been the one to track down Isobel because it takes away my quick fix of Isobel being curious about Elena/her life, and Jenna being clueless about Isobel's identity. On the other hand, there's also nothing to say that there can't have been human on human college experimentation, or a vampire on human night of memory clouding drunken debauchery that might pop back up in Jenna's mind at the perfect 'oh shit' moment later on!
</lj-cut>
4. La Femme Nikita: Nikita/Quinn

While my heart is not totally closed to the wonders of Michael and Birkoff, Nikita is simply too awesome to be wasted on men. But I suffered the fate of the picky femslasher and couldn't find much in the way of pairings I could really feel for until the very end of the show, when they very considerately gave me Quinn!

Nikita is essentially my pre-BSG Kara Thrace. I consider her my own personal lesbian catnip, mmm. Quinn is cute, and devious, and everything all the people who were always pulling Nikita's strings wanted her to be, and I just love that contrast. How I see them together would have to include Quinn being the one to approach Nikita, and Nikita needing to be really worn down before she'd take that particular gamble. I also really love the juxtaposition of Quinn's emotions and her ambitions in her relationship with Operations, and I'd love to see that played out even more in a relationship with Nikita.

I kind of love the idea of Nikita forcibly making Quinn shape up, and Quinn sneaking around and being all sweetly evil anyway. I also don't really like the idea of Nikita and Michael waiting for anyone and being all lonely for so such a long time, not even each other, and I think Nikita would seriously need someone to keep her warm and have her back once he's gone. And we already know warming the beds of powerful people is so Quinn's thing, and Nikita is now officially the most powerful person within her circle of work acquaintances, hee. If going post-series isn't your thing, perhaps you'd care to share the story behind how Nikita managed to subdue Quinn so she could take her appearance, and perhaps her tactic involved sexy times. Or maybe explore Quinn being super conflicted once she realises Nikita is poised to become quite powerful and that she's totally played her cards wrong.
</lj-cut>
5. One Tree Hill: Brooke/Quinn, Brooke/Lindsay

The real key to understanding the way I femslash ship in OTH is understanding that I have a massive crush on Brooke Davis and despite the bazillion femslash options I struggle to settle on a girl ship for her. I was totally thrilled by Brooke/Rachel for a while there, but then they went and messed it up when they jumped four years, grump. But I basically think Brooke's the best thing since sliced bread and I really want to see a girl show her that relationships don't have to end up all doom and gloom like she's found with the boys, because I really want to see her happy and in my mind happiness requires life affirming lesbian sex.

The core of my shipping Brooke with Quinn and Lindsay is that they're all awesome, and they'd be mind blowingly hot together, and I love that they have creativity in common. I'd really love to see Brooke connecting with Quinn or Lindsay over their respect creative loves, because I don't think the show really explores that aspect of Brooke very well. I think she gets short changed in favour of celebrating Peyton's creativity a lot, which is a real shame. It's all fashion is fashionable, and profitable, and fame and fortune and blahblah she loves it, but it never really approaches Brooke as a person who is simply creative or who makes art, and I'd love to see that rectified in fic.

I also adore the whole Brooke wants to adopt storyline, and I'd really love to see that played out as something to soothe the shock of finding out she can't have children and validating that adoption is not greater or less than biological children, and because I would eat up happy domestic fic where Brooke's children have two mummies with a spoon. I also love the idea of Brooke with a long term female partner because I like to see storylines where women adopt because they want to adopt, not just because they're both women.

I think I definitely see Brooke as someone who would be straight until she met the right woman, but once she met the right woman she'd just sort of shrug and say screw the world, because she understands the importance of having love and family in your life. I also think she'd still be a total sexy mother who rocks her partners world, if you did decide to go the domestic happy family times route. Mostly I just want to see Brooke happy and fulfilled and in love, and building her family, and being awesome, however you want to put that together and whoever you want to write her with. :D
</lj-cut>
6. Easy Virtue: Larita/Sarah

Larita is awesome and hot, and Sarah is awesome and hot, and once you take Colin Firth out of the equation there's really nothing better than the idea of them being awesome and hot together. I adore this movie, and I adore the idea of both these characters together, so you could basically just go nuts with it. Basically I like the idea of Larita being exactly like she is in the movie, and Sarah blossoming and fulfilling all that wonderful potential she has.

Some possible ideas could include Sarah being inspired to want something more than a convenient, friendly marriage after Larita's speech at the end of the movie. Sarah revealing that she could only ever have been friends with John if they married because she's really a die hard lesbian at heart, or a missing scene where Sarah agrees to forgive John for not warning her he was married if he let's her hit that (because the whole oh my goodness John, I totally forgive you, she's totally gorgeous thing wasn't subtexty at all!) I'd also love something along the lines of Sarah distracting Larita from all that boring country living, or Sarah finally rebelling against the understanding little future country wife mould everyone's always expected of her and going to find Larita in the city. If you prefer to keep Sarah more like she is in the movie, I'm also totally down with her remaining totally comfortable with living her life in the country, but perhaps she maintains contact with Larita and heads off for a girls weekend of wild times in the city with her every once in a while? I can't see her taking a no for an answer if she wanted to go post-marrying John, after all! Or perhaps she doesn't do the expected and marry John, but runs her future estate on her own and continues to be an English countryside BAMF, and Larita occasionally comes to visit for the weekend, etc.
